articles.headline: Seizing on Rising Costs, Trump Says Health Law Is ‘Over’
articles.snippet: The Trump campaign, desperate for a winning political issue in the final two weeks of the race, mounted an offensive against the Affordable Care Act.
articles.abstract: The Trump campaign, desperate for a winning political issue in the final two weeks of the race, mounted an offensive against the Affordable Care Act.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump, desperate for a winning political issue in the final two weeks of the presidential race, fiercely attacked Hillary Clinton on Tuesday over sharp premium increases that will hit some Americans covered under the Affordable Care Act.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Abby Goodnough

articles.headline: Why a Media Merger That Should Go Through Might Not
articles.snippet: Under longstanding antitrust policy, the AT&T-Time Warner deal should be practically a shoo-in. But these are not usual times.
articles.abstract: Under longstanding antitrust policy, the AT&T-Time Warner deal should be practically a shoo-in. But these are not usual times.
articles.lead_paragraph: Opponents of the proposed AT&T purchase of Time Warner don’t want to just block the $85.4 billion deal: They want to overturn decades of antitrust policy and case law.

articles.headline: One Last Growl for F.C.C.’s Sharp-Toothed Watchdog
articles.snippet: Tom Wheeler, who increased regulation of the cable and wireless industries, now faces tough industry opposition and a review of a media megadeal.
articles.abstract: Tom Wheeler, who increased regulation of the cable and wireless industries, now faces tough industry opposition and a review of a media megadeal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Obama picked Tom Wheeler, a former cable and wireless lobbyist, to head the Federal Communications Commission in 2013, AT&T celebrated the pick as “inspired” and the cable industry said it was “exceptional.”

articles.headline: Relief at Last for U.S. Owners of Diesel Volkswagens
articles.snippet: A judge has approved a deal for Volkswagen to buy back or fix vehicles affected in the emissions-cheating scandal.
articles.abstract: A judge has approved a deal for Volkswagen to buy back or fix vehicles affected in the emissions-cheating scandal.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the owners of nearly a half-million diesel cars in the United States who have been caught up in Volkswagen’s emissions-cheating scandal, relief may finally be in sight.

articles.headline: ISIS Sent Four Car Bombs. The Last One Hit Me.
articles.snippet: After a long day in a convoy near Mosul, it seemed safe for a photographer and Iraqi troops to exit their vehicle. Suddenly someone screamed, “Car bomb!”
articles.abstract: After a long day in a convoy near Mosul, it seemed safe for a photographer and Iraqi troops to exit their vehicle. Suddenly someone screamed, “Car bomb!”
articles.lead_paragraph: Mr. Denton, a photographer for The New York Times, was with Iraqi counterterrorism forces as they began pushing toward Mosul last week.
